section.title: Why a Maven Plugin - Motivation
section.para: Increasingly into our projects, we use Apache Maven, MyBatis framework and myBatis migration tool to maintain our database structure. So in order to have a fully integrated tool we started to implement a solution that integrates mybatis migration tool into a standard Apache Maven build life cycle.
The aim of mybatis maven-migration-plugin is to perform a complete porting of all mybatis migration tool commands to standard maven plugin.

section.title: A little bit of history
section.para: The mybatys maven-migration-plugin was born in April 2010 after a skype conference with Marco Speranza and Simone Tripodi where we was looking for a solution to integrate mybatis migration tool to our softrware build life cycle. The project was created and maintained by the 99soft.org and posted on Google code with the name maven-migrate-plugin maven-migrate-plugin.

In September 2010 Simone Tripodi and Clinton Begin has accepted Marco Speranza to join into MyBatis community and bringing with him the maven-migration-plugin code base to become an official MyBatis subproject.
By that day, the MyBatis Migration Maven Plugin project is maintained by the MyBatis.org team.

section.title: Requirements
section.para: Before starting reading the manual, it is very important you're familiar with both MyBatis Migration Tool and Apache Maven and therminology, otherwise it would be very difficult to understand the described context.
